data.title: Nothing Special
data.text: There are numerous varieties of sports bars in the marketplace. To stand out from the crowd you need to do things better than the rest. This place falls flat. The food is below average. My burger was overdone, overwhelmed by a massive bun and just had little beef flavor. The fries are pedestrian. Atmosphere is average. And the staff - at least my waiter - could not answer even the most basic questions about their fairly impressive beer list. Overall, you can easily do much better at other sports bars in the area.

data.title: Too many varieties to enjoy in one visit
data.text: Get selection of on-tap and bottled bears.  Service was prompt and accurate.  A little surprised by the small serving size on the craft brews, but still great quality.  Dinner was above average pub food with good selection and well prepared.

data.title: Standard beer and food joint
data.text: Recently stopped by with some friends on our way back from Ann Arbor. It did the job for us because we were looking for a drink. It has a large selection of beers to choose from which was nice. The feel seemed pretty standard to me, but I went for the beer alone to be honest. If you want a good large selection of beers for your night out, you can certainly get it here.

data.title: Happy We Stopped In!
data.text: We were on 696 and saw the road sign for Craft Breww City, exit right and there you are! Lucky for us it was Happy Hour and a Football Saturday!  Actually all their Happy Hour hours are really good, but especially the weekend! The beer selection is huge with quality craft beers on tap and bottles.  The menu items also sounded good; we had the spinach artichoke dip with a couple of beers. Good portion size and tasty, came with tortilla chips and side of salsa. CBC is a spacious place with several types of separate seating areas and a lot of tv's. Servers were knowledgeable, nice and attentive. I'm glad we stopped at Craft Breww City and will be back. Recommend you try it too!

data.title: Great staff, upbeat atmosphere
data.text: Was staying at hotel across the street. Went in for quick bite and drink. What I had was great spinach artichoke dip, ahi tuna salad and Brussels sprouts. Brussel sprouts were amazing.

data.title: fantastic beer selection!
data.text: i've visited cbc a couple of times with friends. the beer selection is fantastic and the food is good. this is an excellent place for a beer and a burger!

data.title: Good Ambiance, Great Burgers
data.text: We came here for a low-key Sunday dinner. The burgers were delicious, but the fries were a little cold and my pop was a bit flat. My husband enjoyed his burger, beer, and fries. The service was fine, just a little slow getting started. Great ambiance. Lots of TVs and great decor. We'd come back.

data.title: Great beer selection and interesting menu
data.text: I visited Craft Breww City with my family. Was a bit nervous about this at first, not knowing if the restaurant was kid friendly. But, it was a great place for kids. They have a  decent food menu. I had the Peanut Butter and Sriracha Burger which tasted great, especially paired with some Tater-Tots.  I only wish they used a hand packed patty instead of a formed burger. They have a small kids menu which is decently priced. Their beer selection is wide and varied. I liked that they offered flights of beers, so I was able to try some 4 oz glasses of beers before i get the whole pint. The restaurant wasn't overly busy on a Saturday night and we were able to get right in. Our server Taylor was good. He was friendly and prompt. Overall I enjoyed the visit.

data.title: Came mostly for drinks. Service was decent. Food smelled good, but looked like regular bar food.
data.text: I had some ginger beer and was happy they had the stuff, rare to get a decent non-alcoholic drink in a beer place. Outside patio was pretty laid back, but a bit narrow, maybe better to just have one table up and down instead of trying to fit 2 side by side. Inside was busy, but the crowd looked like a crowd I would see at BWs.

data.title: Good beer choices, average food
data.text: If you want a place to go for a beer and watch a game, then Breww City is a good choice.  But otherwise, they are mostly serving average bar food. Overall, they had some great beer choices and I went with a red beer they had on tap which was tasty.  For my meal, I the mushroom-Swiss burger and fries.  The burger was good; not great but a good bar burger.  Would I rush back; probably not as there was nothing outstanding about this restaurant, but nothing really wrong with it either.

data.title: Food, beer and friends - good combination.
data.text: Lots of choices on both food and drink.  A little loud but a fun setting and a place we like to frequent.

data.title: Drinks Only
data.text: Honestly we have not ordered food here yet but the beer selection is enough to bring me back anytime.  I promise to review again once we try the food but sometimes a drink takes priority.  A great place after a long day at the office.

data.title: Just okay
data.text: Tried this place finally. The outdoor seating is nice and so is the indoor set up. Lots of seating and fun atmosphere. As far as the food goes, we tried the Chicago style spinach artichoke dip which is no different than the usual but was very runny in consistency. I also got the Bloomfield chop salad which was just ok. My friend got the steak bites and said they were pretty good. Overall this a better place for drinks, as they have a large selection to choose from.

data.title: Pretty good
data.text: Went there for an early dinner on a Sunday. Great beer choices. Service was very friendly however the couple of waitstaff at the bar were overworked. They definitely needed more help so you had to wait a while for drinks and to place orders for food. We tried a few things from the happy hour list (all day Sunday). I didn't care for the deviled eggs because they were horsey (unadvertised) but my husband enjoyed them. Tried the spinach dip and it was very good. We also had the steak bites. They could have been good if they were cooked medium to medium rare but unfortunately they were cooked well done. My son had a burger on a pretzel bun and he enjoyed it. We will definitely go back--just hoping there will be more waitstaff next time.

data.title: Quiet place to meet on a Sunday afternoon
data.text:
We needed a place to meet to exchange information. The place needed to have wifi.
Someplace where we could have something to drink and eat about halfway between us. We chose this place. There are booths, then there is the bar section, open to seeing everyone. Nice place, quiet on a Sunday afternoon.

data.title: Great food, great atmosphere, great service!
data.text: We've been here twice and had a wonderful experience both times.  It's a spacious, well designed facility, there are wide screen HD TV's all over the place, the food is terrific, beer selection is amazing, wine list offers some very nice choices and the staff is very friendly, and professional.  Last night, we decided to sit at the bar in order to watch the Masters on a screen right over the bar.  Our server/bartender was Janis and she did a remarkable job of taking care of us and many other customers at the bar, while also scrambling diligently and efficiently to fill the flood of orders coming from the servers attending to customers at their tables.  Happy Hour really bustles at CBC and none of the staff ever stops moving.  Janis is very friendly, personable and attentive and we were totally happy with the way she welcomed us and took care of us.  We'll definitely continue visiting CBC!

data.title: Football sunday
data.text: Great burgers and bloody Mary's with bacon. Televisions everywhere and a very large bar that wraps around. Many beers on tap especially craft beers, they even carry PBR.

data.title: Beer Selection
data.text:
Went with a colleague for dinner on a Tuesday night, sat at the bar and had a good dinner. I had a really good burger with a bunch of beer samples - they do flights and you can choose any beer as a 4 ounce sampler.  The beer menu is helpful in that they list each beer's price not only for a pint, but also for the 4 ounce sampler.  So make up your own flight or just taste one by one.  
Good comfortable, spacious bar with views of several TVs. There's pool tables and plenty of dining room seating.  Service at the bar was very good.
A couple of drawbacks, the first being as others here have noted, being the noise.  It's just a loud room. It was a decent crowd but not packed and it was still loud. 
And then there's the beer.  Don't get me wrong, they have a great selection of craft and cans and bottles.  The problem I had was sampling local beers I found the majority of them were average or below. Maybe it's the state of craft beer today where everyone is trying to trick up every batch so much that most of them are missing the mark.  Anyway, I was hoping for a better mix of "classic styles" from local breweries as well as some unique brews.  But it made for great tasting.

data.title: Decided to try their creativity
data.text: We came here for a family lunch and I decided to try their bacon, siracha and peanut butter burger. It was definitely a new experience for my taste buds. Loved the peanut butter with the burger but would have left off siracha. Everyone else had more traditional choice. We'd probably come again but I'd try something different.

data.title: Very Noisy - food was good
data.text: Great selection of craft beer. Went there for dinner on a Friday night. Very noisy and packed. Not a place to go if you want to chat with your company. Service was good.
